thread.title: Swiss Airlines video shows 360 degree view from cockpit
thread.title_full: Swiss Airlines video shows 360 degree view from cockpit

author: Rowena Ryan
title: Swiss Airlines video shows 360 degree view from cockpit
text:
Ever wondered what really happens in the cockpit? Picture: Blick.
Rowena Ryan Escape EVER wondered what really goes on in the cockpit? A new video lets you feel like the pilot with a 360 degree view of takeoff, mid-flight and landing of a Swiss Airlines flight from Zurich to Geneva.
The five-and-a-half minute video was filmed by German YouTube channel Blick and shows Flight commander Luc Wolfensberger and First Officer Martin Radinger in action from taxiing to takeoff and landing as they fly 250 passengers on the Airbus A320 at 39,000 feet.
You can listen as the pilots communicate with the control towers, make an announcement to passengers and point out sights along the way such as Lake Geneva and Mont Blanc.
Use the arrows to make your way around the cockpit from looking out the front windows of the plane to looking back at the pilots as they control the aircraft and watch as they perfectly land at Geneva airport in Switzerland.
Watch the plane takeoff and land from the view of a pilot. Picture: Blick. Source: YouTube
Watch the pilots in action mid-flight. Picture: Blick. Source: YouTube
Originally published as What really happens in the cockpit Jump back to top
